answers.a: Strain distribution being linear across the depth
answers.b: Stress distribution being linear across the depth

answers.d: Shear stress distribution being uniform along the depth

question: Q9. A rectangular beam 200 mm wide has an effective depth of 350 mm. It is subjected to a bending moment of 24,000 Nm. The permissible stresses are c = 5 N/mm<sup>2</sup>, t = 140 N/mm<sup>2</sup>; and m is 18. The required area of tensile reinforced will be

Q10. Two rectangular under-reinforced concrete beam sections X and Y are similar in all aspects except that the longitudinal compression reinforcement in section Y is 10% more. Which one of the following is the correct statement?

answers.a: Section X has less flexural strength and is less ductile than section Y
answers.b: Section X has less flexural strength but is more ductile than section Y
answers.c: Section X and Y have equal flexural strength but different ductility
answers.d: Section X and Y have equal flexural strength and ductility

question: Q11. According to IS 456-2000, which one of the following statements about the depth of neutral axis for a balanced reinforced concrete X<sub>u,bal</sub> section is correct?

answers.a: X<sub>u,bal</sub> depends on the grade of concrete only
answers.b: X<sub>u,bal</sub> depends on the grade of steel only
answers.c: X<sub>u,bal</sub> depends on both the grade of concrete and grade of steel
answers.d: X<sub>u,bal</sub> does not depend on the grade of concrete and grade of steel
